20101204020052.429|20101204020053.857|CCO|MEAN FOR A RECOVERY.
20101204020053.857|20101204020055.286|CCO|>> Brown: PLUS, PAUL SOLMAN

20101204020056.714|20101204020058.143|CCO|FOR RECENT COLLEGE GRADUATES.
20101204020058.143|20101204020059.571|CCO|>> I DON'T WANT TO SEEM
20101204020059.571|20101204020101.000|CCO|UNGRATEFUL, YOU KNOW.
20101204020101.000|20101204020103.500|CCO|I JUST FEEL LIKE I'VE DEVOTED
20101204020103.500|20101204020106.000|CCO|YEARS OF MY LIFE AND THOUSANDS
20101204020106.000|20101204020108.500|CCO|OF DOLLARS INTO DEVELOPING
20101204020108.500|20101204020111.000|CCO|SPECIALIZED SKILLS THAT I'M NOT
20101204020111.000|20101204020112.667|CCO|USING.
20101204020112.667|20101204020114.333|CCO|>> Lehrer: THEN, WE LOOK AT THE
20101204020114.333|20101204020116.000|CCO|FAILED VOTE OF A PRESIDENTIAL
20101204020116.000|20101204020117.667|CCO|COMMISSION TO APPROVE A PLAN FOR
20101204020117.667|20101204020119.333|CCO|CUTTING THE DEFICIT.
20101204020119.333|20101204020121.000|CCO|>> WE TOOK A BIG BANANA AND
20101204020121.000|20101204020123.000|CCO|THREW IT INTO THE GORILLA
20101204020123.000|20101204020125.000|CCO|CAGE AND THE GORILLA HAS
20101204020125.000|20101204020127.000|CCO|PICKED IT UP LIKE THEY DO,

20101204020339.000|20101204020341.000|CCO|>> Woodruff: THE PRESIDENT
20101204020341.000|20101204020342.667|CCO|ARRIVED UNANNOUNCED AT BAGRAM
20101204020342.667|20101204020344.333|CCO|AIR FIELD FOR A VISIT OF A
20101204020344.333|20101204020346.000|CCO|LITTLE OVER FOUR HOURS, HIS
20101204020346.000|20101204020347.667|CCO|SECOND TRIP THERE SINCE TAKING
20101204020347.667|20101204020349.333|CCO|OFFICE.
20101204020349.333|20101204020351.000|CCO|HE WAS GREETED AND THEN BRIEFED
20101204020351.000|20101204020353.000|CCO|BY GENERAL DAVID PETRAEUS, THE
20101204020353.000|20101204020355.000|CCO|OVERALL NATO COMMANDER IN
20101204020355.000|20101204020357.000|CCO|AFGHANISTAN, AND KARL
20101204020357.000|20101204020359.000|CCO|EIKENBERRY, THE U.S. AMBASSADOR.
20101204020359.000|20101204020401.000|CCO|MR. OBAMA TALKED WITH AFGHAN
20101204020401.000|20101204020403.500|CCO|PRESIDENT HAMID KARZAI BY PHONE.
20101204020403.500|20101204020406.000|CCO|U.S. AND AFGHAN OFFICIALS SAID
20101204020406.000|20101204020408.500|CCO|BAD WEATHER FORCED THEM TO
20101204020408.500|20101204020411.000|CCO|CANCEL PLANS FOR A FACE-TO-FACE
20101204020411.000|20101204020413.000|CCO|SESSION IN KABUL.
20101204020413.000|20101204020415.000|CCO|AFTER VISITING WITH WOUNDED

20101204020417.000|20101204020419.000|CCO|IT WAS ON TO A CROWD OF WAITING
20101204020419.000|20101204020421.000|CCO|SERVICEMEN AND WOMEN.
20101204020421.000|20101204020423.000|CCO|>> THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNITED
20101204020423.000|20101204020425.000|CCO|STATES, OUR COMMANDER IN CHIEF
20101204020425.000|20101204020427.000|CCO|PRESIDENT BARACK OBAMA.

20101204020429.000|20101204020431.000|CCO|>> Woodruff: MORE THAN 3,500
20101204020431.000|20101204020432.667|CCO|U.S. TROOPS STOOD CHEERING IN A
20101204020432.667|20101204020434.333|CCO|BAGRAM AIRPLANE HANGAR.
20101204020434.333|20101204020436.000|CCO|>> WE SAID WE WERE GOING TO
20101204020436.000|20101204020437.667|CCO|BREAK THE TALIBAN'S MOMENTUM.
20101204020437.667|20101204020439.333|CCO|THAT'S WHAT YOU'RE DOING--
20101204020439.333|20101204020441.000|CCO|YOU'RE GOING ON THE OFFENSE.
20101204020441.000|20101204020442.667|CCO|TIRED OF PLAYING DEFENSE.
20101204020442.667|20101204020444.333|CCO|TARGETING THEIR LEADERS, PUSHING
20101204020444.333|20101204020446.000|CCO|THEM OUT OF THEIR STRONGHOLDS.
20101204020446.000|20101204020447.667|CCO|WE WILL NEVER LET THIS COUNTRY
20101204020447.667|20101204020449.333|CCO|SERVE AS A SAFE HAVEN FOR

20101204020458.500|20101204020501.000|CCO|>> Woodruff: THIS VISIT CAME A
20101204020501.000|20101204020504.333|CCO|YEAR AFTER THE PRESIDENT DECIDED
20101204020504.333|20101204020507.667|CCO|TO DEPLOY ANOTHER 30,000
20101204020507.667|20101204020511.000|CCO|AMERICANS TO AFGHANISTAN,
20101204020511.000|20101204020512.667|CCO|RAISING THE TOTAL TO 100,000.
20101204020512.667|20101204020514.333|CCO|>> WE COULD NOT PROTECT THE
20101204020514.333|20101204020516.000|CCO|AMERICAN PEOPLE, WE COULD NOT
20101204020516.000|20101204020517.667|CCO|ENJOY THE BLESSINGS OF OUR

20101204020521.000|20101204020522.667|CCO|AND EVERY ONE OF YOU PERFORM
20101204020522.667|20101204020524.333|CCO|EACH AND EVERY DAY.
20101204020524.333|20101204020526.000|CCO|>> Woodruff: THE TRIP OCCURS AT
20101204020526.000|20101204020527.667|CCO|A TOUGH MOMENT FOR ALREADY
20101204020527.667|20101204020529.333|CCO|STRAINED AFGHAN-U.S. RELATIONS.
20101204020529.333|20101204020531.000|CCO|STATE DEPARTMENT CABLES LEAKED
20101204020531.000|20101204020533.000|CCO|BY THE WEB SITE WIKILEAKS THIS
20101204020533.000|20101204020535.000|CCO|WEEK SHOW AMERICAN DIPLOMATS
20101204020535.000|20101204020537.000|CCO|COMPLAINING OF RAMPANT
20101204020537.000|20101204020539.000|CCO|CORRUPTION AT THE HIGHEST LEVELS
20101204020539.000|20101204020541.000|CCO|OF THE AFGHAN REGIME.
20101204020541.000|20101204020543.000|CCO|SOME CRITIQUE KARZAI DIRECTLY.
20101204020543.000|20101204020545.000|CCO|IN ONE 2009 DISPATCH, AMBASSADOR
20101204020545.000|20101204020547.000|CCO|EIKENBERRY DETAILS TWO
20101204020547.000|20101204020549.000|CCO|CONTRASTING VIEWS OF THE AFGHAN
20101204020549.000|20101204020551.000|CCO|LEADER.
20101204020551.000|20101204020553.000|CCO|"THE FIRST IS OF A PARANOID AND
20101204020553.000|20101204020555.000|CCO|WEAK INDIVIDUAL UNFAMILIAR WITH
20101204020555.000|20101204020557.000|CCO|THE BASICS OF NATION BUILDING,"
20101204020557.000|20101204020559.000|CCO|EIKENBERRY SAYS.
20101204020559.000|20101204020601.000|CCO|"THE OTHER IS THAT OF AN EVER-
20101204020601.000|20101204020603.000|CCO|SHREWD POLITICIAN WHO SEES
20101204020603.000|20101204020605.000|CCO|HIMSELF AS A NATIONALIST HERO."
20101204020605.000|20101204020607.000|CCO|AN ADMINISTRATION REVIEW OF THE
20101204020607.000|20101204020609.000|CCO|OVERALL WAR SITUATION IS DUE
20101204020609.000|20101204020611.000|CCO|LATER THIS MONTH.
20101204020611.000|20101204020612.667|CCO|>> Brown: IN THE MEANTIME,
20101204020612.667|20101204020614.333|CCO|AMERICANS GOT THE LATEST REVIEW
20101204020614.333|20101204020616.000|CCO|OF THE U.S. ECONOMIC SITUATION
20101204020616.000|20101204020617.667|CCO|TODAY.
20101204020617.667|20101204020619.333|CCO|BUT THE NOVEMBER JOBS REPORT
20101204020619.333|20101204020621.000|CCO|FELL WELL SHORT OF EXPECTATIONS.
20101204020621.000|20101204020623.000|CCO|THE BLEAK NEWS ON JOBS CAME AS A
20101204020623.000|20101204020625.000|CCO|JOLT TO THOSE ON THE
20101204020625.000|20101204020627.000|CCO|UNEMPLOYMENT LINES AND A
20101204020627.000|20101204020629.000|CCO|SURPRISE TO MOST FORECASTERS.
20101204020629.000|20101204020631.000|CCO|ACCORDING TO TODAY'S LABOR
20101204020631.000|20101204020633.000|CCO|DEPARTMENT REPORT, THE
20101204020633.000|20101204020635.000|CCO|UNEMPLOYMENT RATE CLIMBED TWO-
20101204020635.000|20101204020637.000|CCO|TENTHS OF A PERCENT, TO 9.8% IN
20101204020637.000|20101204020639.000|CCO|NOVEMBER, A SEVEN-MONTH HIGH.
20101204020639.000|20101204020641.000|CCO|MOREOVER, THE RATE HAS NOW
20101204020641.000|20101204020643.500|CCO|TOPPED 9% FOR 19 STRAIGHT
20101204020643.500|20101204020646.000|CCO|MONTHS, THE LONGEST STRETCH ON
20101204020646.000|20101204020648.500|CCO|RECORD.
20101204020648.500|20101204020651.000|CCO|OVERALL, EMPLOYERS ADDED ONLY
20101204020651.000|20101204020653.000|CCO|39,000 NEW JOBS LAST MONTH, FAR
20101204020653.000|20101204020655.000|CCO|BELOW EXPECTATIONS.
20101204020655.000|20101204020657.000|CCO|BUREAU OF LABOR STATISTICS
20101204020657.000|20101204020659.000|CCO|COMMISSIONER KEITH HALL SUMMED
20101204020659.000|20101204020701.000|CCO|THINGS UP AT A CONGRESSIONAL
20101204020701.000|20101204020702.667|CCO|HEARING.
20101204020702.667|20101204020704.333|CCO|>> WE'VE HAD ABOUT 961,000 JOBS
20101204020704.333|20101204020706.000|CCO|THIS YEAR, WHICH IS... WHICH IS
20101204020706.000|20101204020707.667|CCO|GOOD.
20101204020707.667|20101204020709.333|CCO|BUT THE JOB GROWTH JUST HASN'T
20101204020709.333|20101204020711.000|CCO|YET STRENGTHENED ENOUGH TO START
20101204020711.000|20101204020714.333|CCO|LOWERING THE UNEMPLOYMENT RATE.
20101204020714.333|20101204020717.667|CCO|WE'RE SORT OF WAITING FOR STRONG
20101204020717.667|20101204020721.000|CCO|WE ARE GOING TO HAVE TO HAVE
20101204020721.000|20101204020722.111|CCO|STRONGER JOB GROWTH TO START
20101204020722.111|20101204020723.222|CCO|PUTTING PEOPLE BACK TO WORK AND
20101204020723.222|20101204020724.333|CCO|LOWERING THE UNEMPLOYMENT RATE.
20101204020724.333|20101204020725.444|CCO|>> Brown: IT WOULD ALSO TAKE
20101204020725.444|20101204020726.556|CCO|STRONGER GROWTH TO LOWER THE
20101204020726.556|20101204020727.667|CCO|UNDER-EMPLOYMENT RATE OF THOSE
20101204020727.667|20101204020728.778|CCO|WORKING PART-TIME WHEN THEY WANT
20101204020728.778|20101204020729.889|CCO|FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT.
20101204020729.889|20101204020731.000|CCO|THAT RATE IS NOW AT 17%.
20101204020731.000|20101204020733.000|CCO|WITH THE PRESIDENT IN
20101204020733.000|20101204020735.000|CCO|AFGHANISTAN, THE
20101204020735.000|20101204020737.000|CCO|ADMINISTRATION'S RESPONSE CAME
20101204020737.000|20101204020739.000|CCO|FROM VICE-PRESIDENT BIDEN DURING
20101204020739.000|20101204020741.000|CCO|A MEETING AT THE WHITE HOUSE.
20101204020741.000|20101204020743.000|CCO|>> THERE'S NO DENYING THAT THE
20101204020743.000|20101204020745.000|CCO|REPORT IS DISAPPOINTING, BECAUSE
20101204020745.000|20101204020747.000|CCO|WE WERE, QUITE FRANKLY, HOPING
20101204020747.000|20101204020749.000|CCO|FOR EVEN STRONGER JOB GROWTH.
20101204020749.000|20101204020751.000|CCO|BUT THE BOTTOM LINE IS, AND WHAT
20101204020751.000|20101204020752.667|CCO|THIS TELLS US AND MAKES
20101204020752.667|20101204020754.333|CCO|ABSOLUTELY CLEAR IS, THAT WHILE
20101204020754.333|20101204020756.000|CCO|WE'VE MADE PROGRESS CREATING
20101204020756.000|20101204020757.667|CCO|JOBS, IT'S CLEARLY NOT ENOUGH.
20101204020757.667|20101204020759.333|CCO|>> Brown: THE SUBJECT OF THE
20101204020759.333|20101204020801.000|CCO|BIDEN MEETING WAS HOW TO RESTORE
20101204020801.000|20101204020802.667|CCO|BENEFITS THAT BEGAN EXPIRING
20101204020802.667|20101204020804.333|CCO|THIS WEEK FOR THE LONG-TERM
20101204020804.333|20101204020806.000|CCO|UNEMPLOYED, SOME TWO MILLION
20101204020806.000|20101204020807.667|CCO|PEOPLE.
20101204020807.667|20101204020809.333|CCO|>> EXTENDING THAT SUPPORT TO
20101204020809.333|20101204020811.000|CCO|THOSE HARDEST HIT BY THIS CRISIS
20101204020811.000|20101204020812.667|CCO|IS NOT ONLY THE RIGHT THING TO
20101204020812.667|20101204020814.333|CCO|DO-- NOT ONLY THE RIGHT THING TO
20101204020814.333|20101204020816.000|CCO|DO, WHICH WE ALWAYS HAVE DONE IN
20101204020816.000|20101204020817.667|CCO|SIMILAR CIRCUMSTANCES-- IT IS
20101204020817.667|20101204020819.333|CCO|ECONOMICALLY NECESSARY FOR US TO

20101204022147.667|20101204022149.333|CCO|OF NON-GRADUATES.
20101204022149.333|20101204022151.000|CCO|BUT LAST MONTH, THE JOBLESS RATE
20101204022151.000|20101204022153.000|CCO|FOR OLDER GRADS TOPPED 5% FOR
20101204022153.000|20101204022155.000|CCO|THE FIRST TIME IN 40 YEARS AND
20101204022155.000|20101204022157.000|CCO|FOR GRADS UNDER 25, IT'S 9.5%.
20101204022157.000|20101204022159.000|CCO|RUTGERS PROFESSOR CARL VAN HORN
20101204022159.000|20101204022201.000|CCO|SAYS ABIGAIL LUNETTA IS TYPICAL
20101204022201.000|20101204022203.000|CCO|OF HER GENERATION.
20101204022203.000|20101204022205.000|CCO|>> THE ADVICE THAT THEY'VE
20101204022205.000|20101204022207.000|CCO|GOTTEN SINCE THEY WERE TODDLERS
20101204022207.000|20101204022209.000|CCO|WAS, "GET A COLLEGE DEGREE AND
20101204022209.000|20101204022211.000|CCO|YOU WILL HAVE A SUCCESSFUL
20101204022211.000|20101204022212.429|CCO|ECONOMIC FUTURE."
20101204022212.429|20101204022213.857|CCO|AND I WANT TO EMPHASIZE THAT IS
20101204022213.857|20101204022215.286|CCO|STILL IS A BETTER BET THAN NOT,
